inspiration.content: I was a little anxious about this dive because …. I talked with my guide and fellow buddies and they helped me get over it, so I felt I was ready to go.
inspiration.title: Anxiety

inspiration.content: I was really excited by that dive. I had been waiting for it for weeks because …
inspiration.title: Excitement

inspiration.content: As usual, I had forgotten how much weight I was supposed to put on with a 5mm suit.
inspiration.title: Weight belt

inspiration.content: Diving with Nitrox means that you must remember to adjust your dive computer settings before each dive.
inspiration.title: Tank mix

inspiration.content: The dive master gave us a briefing about the topography and the species we were likely to encounter. He showed us the and signs for the most peculiar species.
inspiration.title: Dive briefing

inspiration.content: Fins, Mask, Weights, Air full, Air on, Computer, Camera. Better check that you have everything before you step into the dingy!
inspiration.title: Gearing up

inspiration.content: Well, not so long, but short distances feel long when you're carrying half your weight on your shoulders!
inspiration.title: Long walk

inspiration.content: We had some fun jumping from the boat while one of us was filming.
inspiration.title: Acrobatic jump

inspiration.content: Because of the strong current, we had to perform a negative entry in order to reach our bottom depth quickly and make sure we don't get spread.
inspiration.title: Negative entry

inspiration.content: There were big waves on the surface, we could still feel the swell during the first few meters.
inspiration.title: Big waves

inspiration.content: I / someone had some trouble going down. Ears are such a small part of your body, and yet, they decide whether you'll stay onboard, or be a fish.
inspiration.title: Ear problem

inspiration.content: The water felt really cold! I could feel it flooding my wetsuit.
inspiration.title: Cold water

inspiration.content: It's the first time I encounter this species.
inspiration.title: First time

inspiration.content: I spent time browsing app species index and the books, but I still have no clue about what I saw. Maybe someone will find when I upload the picture on tortuba!
inspiration.title: Unidentified species

inspiration.content: Those two fishes were acting in a peculiar way,
inspiration.title: Funny behavior

inspiration.content: This little guy was really well hidden behind his rock.
inspiration.title: Hidden fellow

inspiration.content: We swam in the middle of huge schools of …. I could spend hours watching them evolve around me.
inspiration.title: Huge schools

inspiration.content: Wow! That's one of the biggest fish I ever saw!
inspiration.title: Big fish

inspiration.content: This fish was small, but its colors and shape are stunning!
inspiration.title: Small fish

inspiration.content: We spent some time at the cleaning station, watching the big game coming and going to get their teeth and gills cleaned.
inspiration.title: Cleaning station

inspiration.content: During night dive we saw a fish trying to swallow a smaller one. Life is tough out there!
inspiration.title: Hunting

inspiration.content: As we were watching a nudibranch, another one came by and they started to mate.
inspiration.title: Mating

inspiration.content: I'm really proud of that picture I took of a …
inspiration.title: Awesome picture

inspiration.content: There was nothing. No life, only desert rocks and sand patches :(
inspiration.title: Barren lands

inspiration.content: We spent the whole time diving along a huge wall, we couldn't see the bottom of it.
inspiration.title: Wall

inspiration.content: The shallow reef is a colorful and lively place. Finishing the dive there was like a cherry on top of the cake.
inspiration.title: Shallow reef

inspiration.content: We came accross big boulders and spent some time behind them looking for small sea life, protected from the current.
inspiration.title: Big boulders

inspiration.content: Sandy patches often host sandy eels, and indeed, we saw a whole bunch of them.
inspiration.title: Sandy patches

inspiration.content: We spent our whole dive 1 meter away from the sand, looking for small unreal creatures.
inspiration.title: Muck diving

inspiration.content: Pinnacles all around! It was a good time to practice our orientation skills…
inspiration.title: Lots of pinnacles

inspiration.content: Diving in the blue is quite an experience, …
inspiration.title: In the blue

inspiration.content: We spent a good time around wreck, watching how life had conquered it entirely.
inspiration.title: Ship wreck

inspiration.content: At some point we followed our guide below a rock. There was a school of small fishes there.
inspiration.title: Swim through

inspiration.content: There was a lot of current at this place so we let ourselves carried away by the current while watching the reef below us.
inspiration.title: Drift diving

inspiration.content: There was absolutely no current, it was like diving in a swimming pool.
inspiration.title: Swimming pool

inspiration.content: It was full moon, there was so much light we could have dived without flashlights!
inspiration.title: Night dive

inspiration.content: The water was so warm I went diving with my bathing suit only.
inspiration.title: Warm water

inspiration.content: The water was really clear, we could see more than 40m all around.
inspiration.title: Crystal clear water

inspiration.content: The current was really strong so we didn't go very far against it.
inspiration.title: Strong current

inspiration.content: I could barely see the divers in front of me.
inspiration.title: Poor visibility

inspiration.content: It's always a little bit destabilizing when you see your bubbles going down instead of up.
inspiration.title: Down current

inspiration.content: The water was really cold. I heard about some ways to get warm… but didn't need to try them in the end.
inspiration.title: Cold

inspiration.content: Some bubbles were coming out of one of the flexibles.
inspiration.title: Equipment issue

inspiration.content: Because of the poor visibility and the strong current, part of the group got separated. But all is well that ends well.
inspiration.title: Lost

inspiration.content: I spent my whole dive with some water in my mask. I would remove it, but after a couple minutes it was back again. Heh.
inspiration.title: Water in the mask

inspiration.content: I had some troubles adjusting my buoyancy.
inspiration.title: Buoyancy

inspiration.content: I breathed heavily on this one, I ended up with a lot less bars than my buddy.
inspiration.title: Air consumption

inspiration.content: While we were doing our safety stop, we had a nice surprise and saw a …
inspiration.title: Unexpected encounter

inspiration.content: I had to pace myself going up because my ear was blocked.
inspiration.title: Ear problem

inspiration.content: We went sligthly over the limits and had to a couple more minutes at the safety stop.
inspiration.title: Deco time

inspiration.content: I was slightly underweighted and it was difficult to stay at 5m for the safety stop, I was constantly pulled to the surface.
inspiration.title: Hard to stabilize at the safety stop

inspiration.content: Everybody was cheerful after the dive, it was such an amazing experience.
inspiration.title: Happiness all around

inspiration.content: There's nothing like a hot tea after 45" in a freezing water!
inspiration.title: Hot beverage

inspiration.content: Last dive of the day means that beer is back in the game!
inspiration.title: Beer time

inspiration.content: Sleeping, diving, eating. I could get used to it!
inspiration.title: Meal time
